Race.SpecificTitle: Sales Tax Dist. No. 1 of the City of Bastrop -- .5% S&U Tax Renewal - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sales Tax District No. 1 of the City of Bastrop Proposition
(Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Sales Tax District No. 1 of the City of Bastrop, State of Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one-half of one percent (.5%) (the "Tax") for a ten (10) year period commencing January 1, 2025, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption and storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, all as defined in La. R.S. 47:301 through 47:317, inclusive (an estimated $941,285 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), with the proceeds of the Tax hereafter collected (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used for the purpose of maintaining, improving, repairing and extending the streets, sidewalks, alleys, roadways and related drainage, within the territorial limits of the District; and shall the District be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds from time to time for any one or more capital purposes, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bastrop Prop. No. 1 of 4 -- 2.56 Mills Renewal - M&CC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Bastrop Proposition No. 1 of 4
(Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bastrop, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew the levy and collection of a special tax of 2.56 mills on the dollar on all property subject to taxation in the City, pursuant to an election held on November 2, 2004 (an estimated $128,601.97 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2024 and ending with the year 2043, for the purpose of acquiring, maintaining, and constructing playgrounds, recreation centers, and other recreational facilities of the City, and shall the City be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the tax into bonds from time to time for any one or more capital purposes, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bastrop Prop. No. 2 of 4 -- 3.23 Mills Renewal - M&CC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Bastrop Proposition No. 2 of 4
(Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bastrop, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew the levy and collection of a special tax of 3.23 mills on the dollar on all property subject to taxation in the City, pursuant to an election held on November 2, 2004 (an estimated $162,259.50 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2024 and ending with the year 2043, for the purpose of operating, maintaining, improving and enlarging the existing fire protection system of the City, and shall the City be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the tax into bonds from time to time for any one or more capital purposes, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bastrop Prop. No. 3 of 4 -- 0.65 Mills Renewal - M&CC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Bastrop Proposition No. 3 of 4
(Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bastrop, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew the levy and collection of a special tax of 0.65 mills on the dollar on all property subject to taxation in the City, pursuant to an election held on November 2, 2004 (an estimated $77,283.29 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2024 and ending with the year 2043, for the purpose of acquiring, maintaining, and operating public cemeteries of the City, and shall the City be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the tax into bonds from time to time for any one or more capital purposes, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Bastrop Prop. No. 4 of 4 -- 0.65 Mills Renewal - M&CC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Bastrop Proposition No. 4 of 4
(Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Bastrop, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew the levy and collection of a special tax of 0.65 mills on the dollar on all property subject to taxation in the City, pursuant to an election held on November 2, 2004 (an estimated $77,283.29 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2024 and ending with the year 2043, for the purposes of constructing, maintaining, and improving public buildings of the City, and shall the City be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the tax into bonds from time to time for any one or more capital purposes, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Bonita Prop. No. 1 of 2 -- 35 Mills Tax - M&BOA - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Village of Bonita Proposition No. 1 of 2
(Ad Valorem Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall the Village of Bonita, State of Louisiana (the "Village"), be authorized to levy a special tax of thirty-five (35) mills on the dollar on all the property subject to taxation in the Village, (an estimated $50,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2042, to be dedicated and used for any lawful municipal purposes and for the acquisition, construction, repair and/or improvement of new or existing capital projects?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Bonita Prop. No. 2 of 2 -- 1/2% S&U Tax - M&BOA - Perp.
Race.SummaryText:
Village of Bonita Proposition No. 2 of 2
(Sales and Use Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall the Village of Bonita, State of Louisiana (the "Village"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 29 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, as amended, and other authority, be authorized, to levy and collect a sales and use tax of one half of one percent (1/2%) on sales at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales and services within the Village, as defined by law, inclusive (the "Tax") (an estimated $10,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), perpetually commencing effective April 1, 2023, and shall the proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administration) be dedicated and used for any lawful municipal purposes and for the acquisition, construction, repair and/or improvement of new or existing capital projects?
